intro: Morongia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved morong, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and spikes of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Morongia microphylla is relatively drought-tolerant once established, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
